content.description:
A biologist wrote a program to simulate the population of a sample of bacteria. The program uses the following procedures.

Procedure Call
Explanation

InitialPopulation ()
Returns the number of bacteria at the start of the simulation

NextPopulation (currPop)
Based on the current value of currPop, returns the number of bacteria after one hour

Code for the simulation is shown below.

hours <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mo>←</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> 0

startPop <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> InitialPopulation ()

currentPop <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> startPop

REPEAT UNTIL ((hours ≥ 24) OR (currentPop ≤ 0))

{

currentPop <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> NextPopulation (currentPop)

hours <math alttext="←" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>←</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> hours + 1

}

DISPLAY (currentPop - startPop)
content.question:
Which of the following are true statements about the simulation?

The simulation continues until either 24 hours pass or the population reaches 0.

The simulation displays the average change in population per hour over the course of the simulation.

The simulation displays the total population at the end of the simulation.
